summary.p: The volume 1 of a 4-volume Kantapurāṇam (BnF Indien 324-327).
The Kantapurāṇam is one of the major Tamil texts about the god Skanda/Murukaṉ. It is the work of Kacciyappa Civācāriyār (14th century?).
The present manuscript is the first volume of a multi-volume manuscript in four volumes (BnF Indien 324-327).
Paratexts: marginal benedictions; invocation page; marginal chapter headers; in-text chapter completion statement and total stanzas; colophon.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (June 2019).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated after the date in the colophon of Indien 327 (U2, f163v5). Dated t0 1830 by Vinson in Vinson & al. (1866-), on the basis of the colophon, and by Cabaton (1912).

provenance.p: Copied for Philippe Ducler by an unnamed copyist in Karaikal Jail. See Burnouf (1832).

acquisition.p: Acquired, July 22nd, 1833, from Philippe Ducler. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1833-1848, no. 76.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
